articles.author: Caroline Valetkevitch
articles.description: U.S. stocks were sharply higher in afternoon trading Wednesday, with the S&P 500 and Nasdaq up more than 1% each, as shares of Nvidia (NVDA.O) gained ahead of quarterly results from the company whose chips are widely used for artificial intelligence (AI) computing.
articles.title: Indexes jump, AI chip maker Nvidia up ahead of results

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chip designer Nvidia (NVDA.O) forecast third-quarter revenue above Wall Street targets on Wednesday, boosted by soaring demand for its chips that power nearly all the world's major artificial intelligence apps.
articles.title: Nvidia forecasts third-quarter revenue above Wall Street expectations

articles.author: Deborah Sophia
articles.description: Abercrombie & Fitch (ANF.N) raised its annual sales forecast on Wednesday after its second-quarter results comfortably beat estimates on strong demand for latest fashion styles at its Abercrombie label and improved assortment at Hollister.
articles.title: Abercrombie & Fitch raises sales forecast as fresh clothing styles draw shoppers

articles.author: Hari Kishan
articles.description: Global stock markets are heading for a correction in coming months, though overall they should post marginal gains between now and the end of 2023, according to a majority of analysts polled by Reuters.
articles.title: Global stock market correction likely before year-end: Reuters poll

articles.author: Carolina Mandl, Chris Prentice
articles.description: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Wednesday voted to overhaul rules for private equity and hedge funds, but in a victory for the industry did not make it easier for investors to sue fund managers and also did not ban arrangements that make it easier for some investors to cash out than others.
articles.title: US SEC overhauls rules for $20 trillion private fund industry

articles.author: Paul Lienert, Ben Klayman
articles.description: Hybrid gasoline-electric vehicles may not be dying as fast as some predicted in the auto sector’s rush to develop all-electric models.
articles.title: Focus: Gas-electric hybrid vehicles get a boost in the US from Ford, others

articles.author: Lisa Baertlein
articles.description: During the worst shipping delays of the early pandemic, consumer and transportation analysts predicted U.S. retailers would buy more goods than they needed to prevent future disruptions from turning into empty store shelves, but a new analysis suggests they are returning to old habits.
articles.title: Big US retailers' 'just-in-time inventory' habit makes a comeback

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian mercenary chief Yevgeny Prigozhin was listed as a passenger on a private jet which crashed north of Moscow on Wednesday, the TASS news agency reported, citing Rosaviatsia, Russia's aviation authority.
articles.title: Russian mercenary chief Prigozhin listed as passenger on plane which crashed with no survivors - authorities

articles.author: Nathan Layne, Gram Slattery
articles.description: Republicans seeking their party's 2024 U.S. presidential nomination are expected to train their rhetorical fire on Ron DeSantis at their first debate on Wednesday, after front-runner Donald Trump opted to skip the event.
articles.title: Republicans to target DeSantis at first 2024 presidential debate

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: North Korea launched what appeared to be a space launch vehicle on Thursday, South Korea's military said, in what would be the North's second such attempt this year after a May launch crashed.
articles.title: North Korea launches space rocket months after failed satellite attempt
